result.execSummary:
The defendant Clark W Doxtator was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

NOTE: Probation sentence as to both this case and Case# 15CM001383. Probation sentence may be served in Brown County.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim without the approval of the court.

Successfully complete a BIP training program.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clark W Doxtator

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revocation Order And Warrant received and file. os

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered the time in the House of Correction, previously ordered and STAYED  for review on today's date, be STAYED until the termination of probation or for future use at the agent's discretion.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Clark W Doxtator in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court ordered defendant to serve 3  MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 5 days served.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  2  YEARS  with the following conditions:
NOTE:  Probation sentence as to both this case and Case# 15CM001383.  Probation sentence may be served in Brown County.

- Court ordered 35 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Successfully complete a BIP training program
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Mental Health assessment and comply with any treatment
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court.
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.
  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 10-07-2015

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Clark W Doxtator in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Statement made by Emily W.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Clark W Doxtator in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to branch 4 in trial, case was subsequently spinned to Branch 44 for the Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Request for Substitution of Judge, received and filed by defense.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court amended the Charge to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Clark W Doxtator not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-15-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch4 on 5-29-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-7-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.  mld

15RM004020  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-29-2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMILY W. OR HER RESIDENCE; AND WITNESS:  WILLIAM S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Clark W Doxtator in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Clark W Doxtator in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
